text: again this year you went from being a
somebody who reports on the news to
becoming part of the news after the
first Republican debate what was that
like for you unpleasant and weird you
know I write and settle for more that I
felt like a human being who had been
dropped into a fish tank with a bunch of
sharks in it and there were all these
horrified passers-by
humans looking into the shark tank
thinking oh gosh how'd she get in there
and I feel like I spent nine months
trying to get myself out of that shark
tank and what was it specifically what
was the repercussion from asking that
question at the first debate well I mean
at first it was nastiness you know
online nastiness from Donald Trump and
his supporters which I was used to I
mean you know you know how it is when
you're a reporter you tend to offend one
side or the other and in my view if
you're not ticking off one side and the
other you're not doing your job right so
I was used to getting blowback from
politicians but this was of an order I
had never seen before and he really
relentlessly kept it up for nine months
which led to a serious security
situation in my life and that of my
family that was ongoing and so you know
I'm a news anchor I don't normally walk
around with bodyguards that is that is
not my life nor do I want it to be and
yet this past year was as I described it
and settle for more of my year of Trump
more guards and more guns the paradox is
of course that during the course of this
campaign your profile has written your
audience has risen you now have a book
that's come out at number one and was it
a confusing situation so I think for
people looking from the inside they
comes up well making Kelley's become
even more famous that must be great for
her career yeah well there's no question
that Donald Trump's attentions if you
will have increased my name recognition
but I would submit to you I was doing
just fine before Donald Trump you know I
was hosting the number two show on all
of cable news number one in its timeslot
I think I was doing just fine I do think
that him targeting me accelerated that
path that I was already on and in some
ways it was you know I I think you'd
have to say it was okay because it led
new people to watch the Kelly file right
but if I had to do it all over again I
would like to have been able to ask that
question and then to have had his anger
dissipate and just to get back to being
a normal news person who wasn't at the
center of the storm Megan do you think
you were treated differently because
you're a powerful woman I've given a lot
of thought to that and I think it was a
combination of the fact that I'm a woman
with power you know that it wasn't just
the fact that I'm a woman but it was
that I'm a woman with power who happens
to be on Donald Trump's favorite Channel
you know the Fox News Channel which he
watches every night and did throughout
this entire year one of the most
interesting things he said to me in the
sit-down I had with him in May was
despite his demands repeated demands
that people boycott the Kelly file he
never did he was watching at night after
night at which I knew because he was
tweeting about it as soon as the show
would end so I think in a way Donald
Trump felt hurt I think he thought we
had a good relationship he thought he
had a good relationship with me with Fox
News with the anchors and the management
there all of which was true and he felt
betrayed that I would ask him a question
like that and that that I would then go
on to cover him skeptically when he
deserved it what is it you want
when you talk about settling for more
what's the more that you want now Megan
well I mean I write about this in the
book which is I think settle for more is
an ongoing process and it's not like you
say okay I nailed it now I'm good
forever you have to keep doing that gut
check and asking yourself what more
means for you and for me there's no
question that right now it's how do I
spend more time with my children
as they age now are on the exact
opposite schedule of the one I keep you
know they go to school from 8 to 3:30
and I go into work around 3:30 or 4 so I
have to figure out a way to do better
there and they're my number one priority
as important as my job is to me as much
as I love it they're more important and
that is something I refuse to miss
